name: Worm!
description:
A Snake clone made the year before Nokia made it go viral!

Move Worm around the screen and collect the numbers.  Worm's tail will grow with each number collected.

See how long you can get without hitting your tail or the walls!

Controls:

Use a joystick in Port 2 to move Worm around the screen.

Shift Lock will pause the game.

Additional Info:

This was the first entirely machine language game I made, created to help me learn how to use assembly language.

It features my first attempt at using the SID chip and my first attempt at a bitmap screen.

It was put together using a Commodore 64, Action Replay VI cartridge and Datasette.

Credits:

Code, graphics and sound by Graham Axten, 1996
